system.description: A large (2m diameter) pressurized plastic bubble. Piezoelectric layers in the bubble wall translate the user's movements into electricity to recharge the bubble's batteries and power its distress beacon, and a small oxygen tank both inflates the bubble and provides two person/hours of life support. A self-repairing plastic seal serves as an emergency airlock. Rescue bubbles are found on both space vessels and water craft as emergency lifeboats.

cf.path: Data Entry#/CF_SEP/CE SRD#/CF_SEP/CE SRD Survival Equipment
